node.title: Oral health and overall health
node.label: 19. May 2020
node.introduction: How much do you know? Maybe you haven't given it much thought, after all who thinks that joint pain, confusion or heart health is related to their mouth. Surprisingly it is!

node.title: Dogs and Gut Health
node.label: 15. May 2020
node.introduction: If you have a dog, ask yourself this question. Why did you make the decision to get him or her?

node.title: Pecan Banana Bread
node.introduction: It's super filling and packed full of good fats which will keep you full and help stabilise blood sugar. Great for breakfast or as an afternoon snack.

node.title: Tahini, Date & Cacao Cookies
node.introduction: Nothing beats a cuppa and a bit of homemaking! These cookies are super delicious and a good source of protein, fibre and energy giving B vitamins.

node.text:
Today's lunch was delicious. Garlicy, thyme mushrooms on toast with a side of asparagus. Use a good quality sour dough or whole grain bread to increase nutrients and flavour! I used a gluten free seeded sour dough and drizzled it with extra virgin olive oil after toasting. 
Mushrooms contain B vitamins & vitamin D and are a good source of selenium which is important for thyroid and immune health. A portion of asparagus (80g) has over 50% of your vitamin K requirements essential for bone health and is also high in folate, vitamins A and C. #lockdownlunches #glutenfree #dairyfree #veganlunches #eatmoreveggies #eattherainbow #5aday #fiveaday #feelgoodfoodie #plantbased #feedthemicrobiome #plantbased #nutrition #nutrition #personalisednutrition #immunehealth #thyroidhealth #rebalancingyou #rebalance #stuffontoast

Lunch today was this antioxidant, vitamin and mineral rich simple salad topped with a hot smoked salmon fillet. Satisfaction guaranteed ðŸ˜Ž (if you like salmon)
Salmon is a great source of protein and is rich in omega 3 fatty acids which have many benefits including reducing inflammation and lowering blood pressure. Try to eat 2-3 portions a week. Wild salmon is best but smoked, tinned fresh or frozen is also perfectly fine. It all counts! 
#glutenfree #dairyfree #lockdownlunches #feelgoodfoodie #feedthemicrobiome #omega3fattyacids #eathealthyfood #fiveaday #healthychoices #healthylifestyle #rebalancingyou #plantpower #eatmoreveggies #nutrition #nutrition

Rainbow Cashew Fried Rice! So good!
Who needs takeaway!
âœ…Heat some oil, until smoking hot! I used coconut.
âœ…Add some chopped veg and stir-fry for a few minutes. I used red onion, broccol, peas, grated carrot & red pepper and half a red chilli.
âœ…Add a little vegetable stock to stop it sticking, crack an egg into the pan and mix well so it scrambles. (leave out if vegan)
âœ… Add cooked rice(stir through a little oil to separate grains).
âœ…Mix a tbsp of soy sauce with a teaspoon of curry powder or use a bit each of turmeric, garam masala, ginger and cumin
âœ… Add to pan with a little more stock around 100ml in total. Then add your cashews and stir fry for a few more minutes.
âœ… Then eat! I may of had a glass of chilled white wine with it too! ðŸ˜Ž
#glutenfreeeats #dairyfree #rainbowrice #plantbased #plantpower #eattherainbow
#fakeaway #fridayfeasting #fridayvibes #homemadelunch #quicksupper #rebalancingyou #feedthemicrobiome #healthychoices #healthyfood

metadata.siteDescription: ENERGISE, RESTORE, NOURISH. I'm studying with the renowned Institute for Optimum Nutrition and will qualify next year. Until then, this is a place to inspire and share healthful information, tips, tricks and recipes. I hope to energise, restore and nourish your body mind and soul!
